page.title: 19GHOSTS IN SHERBORNE
page.content: Lord Digby's old house is now a school for girls. It has been haunted by the Blue Lady for many years. Dorset's own dialect poet, William Barnes, claimed in one of his poems, that he didn't only hear the ghost but he "zee'd un " as well. Within the last 25 yrs 2 school caretakers have seen her. Many local people believe that she still trips daintily about the house,usually near the staircase. Other Sherborne ghosts are : Two ghostly monks have been seen passing through the door of Sherborne Abbey. The haunted tunnel under Long Street. In a part of Newland 2 black figures have been seen. Near Castleton Church a ghostly old smith works at his anvil.
